column5: Saw these things in my neighbors trees, flying around like hummingbirds, but more like bee's. Never saw them before and was wondering if anyone knows what they are. We were laughing and saying it was a humbug, hummingbird like a bug.

Well,  I searched around and found out it's a Hummingbird Clearwing Moth. A Daytime moth that commonly is mistaken for hummingbirds. Strange bug and they are pretty big, almost twice the size of those big bumble bee's. Learn something new everyday.
cool, never heard of them   till now
very neat pic, i have seen one before around here, but never able to get a pic.  interesting little bug.  jason
~~~~Looks like a great top water bait

Nice to see your still a master with the camera Deano.....beautiful picture !!  I know everyone used to enjoy your "pics of the week" waaaaaaay back in the day.  jeeez, that musta been about 3  message boards back
Looks like a fuzzy, flying crayfish Tony
Imagine catching that in the face flying down the 401 on a motor bike. OUCH!
I have several of them around our lilac trees as well.. this is the first year I have ever noticed them... very cool looking... it does certainly look like a baby hummingbird.
these thing's were always around when my dad had a bunch of 4 o'clock flowers planted on the side of the house. they are big.
i've seen those things a number of times in my yard over the years

yes first time seeing them also TJ, seem to be lots around too. Thanks for the link.  Lew, i was looking at the old post (i think Gerrit posted a link) last week and went back to some of those (pics of the day) LOL I sure have a lot of pics since then, still like taking pics.
Never seen one before.  Scary looking things, glad they are daytime flyer's. I would not want one flying around me at the campfire!  Looks like might have teeth!  Easton
Great, first June Bugs and NOW THESE !!  Entropy
Those are cool looking.  Are those what make this huge tree cocoons?  Joey
